intro: Cyrtandra involucrata, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its tubular flowers and broad, ovate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and stream banks. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that attract various pollinators. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, Cyrtandra involucrata is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
